28 Ps 472 3 8 10 Jn 1623b 28 Sun May 12 The Ascension of the Lord Acts 11 11 Ps 472 3 6 9 Eph 117 23 or Eph 41 13 or 41 7 11 13 Mk 1615 20 Sixth Sunday of Easter May 5 2024 This weekend May 4th 5th the Church celebrates the Sixth Sunday of Easter In addition our local parish is also celebrating First Holy Communion and May Crowning At our 10 AM Mass our six First Holy Communicants will for the first time approach the altar of the Lord's Sacrifice to receive the Holy Eucharist May we as a parish family continue to support and encourage our First Holy Communicants as they continue to grow in the Faith Speaking of growth I was recently asked how many baptisms we have had since the start of the year While recording last weekend's baptism in our parish's baptismal records I did a quick count Our parish has celebrated ten baptisms since January As of this moment we are also planning for at least three additional baptisms in the coming weeks and several more to follow in the summer months Are we as a parish growing Resoundingly Yes When a child is brought forth for baptism the ritual first acknowledges the joy that comes from their birth and addresses the parents and godparents as follows This community rejoices with you for today the number of those baptized in Christ will be increased How true it is that every baptism is not only a moment of great joy for each individual family but also for our entire parish family as another soul is claimed for Christ The ritual continues promising each family that our parish family will offer them our support in raising your child in the practice of the faith We see this promise being kept both with our First Holy Communicants today and the warm welcome we show to our many new families at Mass each weekend As the saying goes parish that isn't crying is dying Let us continue to support one another with great charity as we work together to pass on the Faith One of the ways we strive to hand on the Faith to our youth is through our Religious Education classes each year Last weekend our classes came to a close for the summer special Thank You to our volunteer catechists Youth Group team and Michelle our Director of Religious Education all of whom have given so generously of their time and talents throughout this past year Interested in volunteering next year Contact the Parish Office With the end of our Religious Education classes for this year our parish campus is beginning to transition into summer mode While we will still have a number of activities offered over the summer this is also a time for normal upkeep and maintenance for our buildings In addition to the normal efforts of maintaining our buildings we will also be looking to put new coats of paint in the parish gym the sacristy and the parish social hall and kitchen This work is made possible because of your support of our parish especially through our Repair Rainy Day Fund envelope Your financial support to this monthly collection helps to ensure the upkeep of our parish buildings for years to come On behalf of our entire parish family present and future who benefits from your support Thank you Baby Bottle Campaign Mother's Day to Father's Day Next weekend we start our annual Baby Bottle Campaign to support local Helping Hands a pregnancy and family resource center based here in town Baby Bottles will be available starting next weekend Mother's Day through June 16th Father's Day We encourage you to take the Baby Bottles home fill them with loose change and donations and then return them to Church All Baby Bottle donations 100 are then donated to Helping Hands Mark Your Calendars Upcoming Events Next weekend will be our first ever Bike Blessing on Saturday May 11th at Noon in the Parking Lot We will be hosting Totus Tuus for 1st 12th Graders the week of June 16th 21st Our Corpus Christi Eucharistic Procession will be after the 10 AM Mass on Sunday June 2nd and will go off campus 06 miles as we bring Jesus into our local community After the procession you're invited to remain for an ice cream social In Christ Fr David PARISH CALENDAR Sat May 4 Confession 420 4:45pm Mass 5:00pm Sun May 5 Mass 7:30am Mass Night Out group will have their monthly meeting on Tuesday May 14 at 7:00PM in the Parish Conference Room If you are in need of a ride please call the Parish Office at (260)824-1380 All women of the Parish are Welcome KNIGHTS OF COLUMBUS Monthly Meeting Tuesday May 7 2024 Recitation of the Holy Rosary at 6:40pm in the Church and meeting in the Parish Social Hall at 7:00PM WELCOME CHILD OF GOD Through water and the word Dominic Luke Yagodinski son of Nate and Veronica Yagodinski became a child of God and was sealed as Christ's own forever through Baptism on Sunday April 28 2024 by Fr David Violi ANNUAL BABY BOTTLE CAMPAIGN Helping Hands Pregnancy Resource Center Beginning Mother's Day weekend May 11th and 12th through Father's Day weekend June 15th and 16th we will be supporting the Annual Baby Bottle Campaign We invite you to take a baby bottle home and fill with loose change or any donation Please make checks payable to Helping Hands as 100 of the donations will be donated straight to them Thank you for your generous support ARE YOU BEING CALLED TO SERVE If so there are many ways to serve the Church and Her members You can start attending the Knights of Columbus meetings or the GIRLs Night Out Womens group meetings You can sign up with the new Meal Train Ministry become a Catechist volunteer for Totus Tuus Summer Program or serve at any of the various ministries within the Parish Its a wonderful way to meet new members of your Parish Family If you are interested in learning more out about the above mentioned opportunities please call the Parish Office at (260)824-1380 Knights of Columbus Father Aloysius Phillips Council 7555 Saint Joseph was a just man a tireless worker the upright guardian of those entrusted to his care May he always guard
